<Summary source="https://sports.yahoo.com/college-football/article/byu-star-receiver-parker-kingston-no-longer-at-school-after-being-arrested-on-rape-charge-014228558.html">
# Summary of Article: BYU star receiver Parker Kingston no longer at school after being arrested on rape charge

**Source:** Yahoo Sports  
**Date:** February 14, 2026  
**Author:** Jack Baer

## Key Facts and Statistics:

- **Parker Kingston** is no longer enrolled at BYU following his arrest on a first-degree felony rape charge
- The charge stems from an alleged incident on **February 23, 2025** in St. George, Utah
- A 20-year-old woman reported the alleged assault to officers at Utah's St. George Regional Hospital
- Kingston made a court appearance on **Friday** (February 13, 2026) and was released on **$100,000 bond** with $10,000 cash paid immediately
- He was initially held without bail
- Kingston is **21 years old**
- If convicted, he faces **five years to life in prison**
- His next court appearance is scheduled for **February 25**

## Court Conditions:
- Must wear a GPS ankle monitor
- Cannot contact his accuser or potential witnesses
- Must remain off social media
- Cannot return to southwestern Utah county except for court appearances

## Athletic Performance (2025 season):
- Led BYU receivers with **67 catches**
- **928 receiving yards**
- **5 receiving touchdowns**
- **119 rushing yards** and **3 rushing touchdowns**
- Earned **first-team All-Big 12 honors**

## Statements:
- **Judge John Walton:** "I found by clear and convincing evidence that Mr. Kingston was a danger to the community"
- **BYU statement:** Acknowledged awareness of the arrest, stated they take allegations seriously and will cooperate with law enforcement, cited privacy laws preventing additional comment
- BYU spokesperson declined to clarify whether Kingston left voluntarily or was expelled

## Additional Context:
- Kingston appeared to announce his engagement at a BYU men's basketball game on Saturday (February 8, 2026), four days before his arrest
</Summary>

<Summary source="https://www.nytimes.com/athletic/7045852/2026/02/13/parker-kingston-byu-expelled-rape-charge/">
# Summary of Article: "BYU expels receiver Parker Kingston days after arrest on felony rape charge"

**Source:** The Athletic  
**Date:** February 14, 2026  
**Author:** Christopher Kamrani

## Key Facts and Statistics:

1. **Parker Kingston's Performance:** Led BYU Cougars in receiving yards (924) and receptions (66) during the 2025 season.

2. **Expulsion and Arrest Timeline:**
   - Kingston was arrested on Tuesday, February 11, 2026, in Provo
   - He was expelled from BYU on Friday night, February 14, 2026
   - He is no longer part of the football program

3. **Charge Details:**
   - Kingston, age 21, faces a felony rape charge
   - The alleged incident occurred on February 23, 2025, in St. George, Utah (more than 250 miles south of Provo)
   - The alleged victim was 20 years old at the time
   - The victim reported the allegations to St. George Regional Hospital on February 27, 2025

4. **Court Proceedings:**
   - First court appearance: Friday afternoon, February 14, 2026 (remote from Purgatory Correctional Facility)
   - Judge: John Walton
   - Bond set at $100,000 with $10,000 cash immediately paid
   - Kingston was released on bond with conditions
   - Next virtual hearing scheduled: February 25, 2026
   - Preliminary in-person hearing scheduled: April 13, 2026, in Fifth District Court in St. George

5. **Investigation Details:**
   - St. George Police Department conducted a year-long investigation
   - Investigation included gathering digital and forensic evidence
   - Interviews conducted with parties involved and other witnesses
   - Investigation concluded and turned over to Washington County Attorney's Office for review

6. **Kingston's Statement:** According to the affidavit, Kingston told investigators that all sexual activity with the woman was consensual.

7. **University Awareness:** BYU administration, athletic administration, and head coach Kalani Sitake were only made aware of the investigation and allegations after Kingston's arrest on February 11, 2026.

8. **Kingston's Status:** Would have been a redshirt senior in 2026.
</Summary>

<Summary source="https://www.espn.com/college-football/story/_/id/47925225/byu-says-wr-parker-kingston-no-longer-student-there-following-rape-charge">
# Summary of Article: "WR Parker Kingston no longer at BYU after rape charge"

**Source:** ESPN.com  
**Date:** 5 days ago (from time of writing)  
**Authors:** Craig Haubert and Tom Luginbill

## Key Facts and Statistics:

1. **Parker Kingston's Status:** The 21-year-old wide receiver is no longer a student at Brigham Young University (BYU) following his arrest on a first-degree felony rape charge.

2. **Arrest Details:** Kingston was arrested after a yearlong investigation. He made his initial court appearance Friday in St. George.

3. **Allegations:** Prosecutors say a woman who was 20 years old at the time told officers that Kingston assaulted her at her home in February (last year).

4. **Investigation:** Detectives collected digital and forensic evidence and interviewed witnesses, according to Washington County Attorney Jerry Jaeger.

5. **Bail and Release Conditions:** 
   - Judge John Walton initially held Kingston without bail, stating he found "by clear and convincing evidence that Mr. Kingston was a danger to the community"
   - Kingston was released on $100,000 bond with $10,000 cash paid immediately
   - Conditions include: no contact with accuser or witnesses, must stay off social media, must wear GPS ankle monitor, cannot return to southwestern Utah county except for court appearances

6. **Potential Sentence:** If convicted, Kingston could serve five years to life in prison.

7. **BYU's Knowledge:** BYU spokesperson Jon McBride stated the administration and coaches were only made aware of the investigation and allegations after Kingston's arrest this week. The spokesperson declined to clarify whether Kingston was expelled or left voluntarily.

8. **Conflicting Accounts:** 
   - Kingston told police "all sexual activity" was "consensual" (according to affidavit)
   - The woman told investigators she made clear to Kingston before he came to her house that she did not want to have sex with him and told him to stop several times

9. **BYU Honor Code Context:** BYU has a strict honor code prohibiting all sexual relations outside of marriage between a man and a woman. Violations can result in suspension and athletes being benched.

10. **Kingston's Athletic Performance:** Kingston was BYU's leading receiver last season.

11. **Next Court Appearance:** Expected February 25.
</Summary>

<Summary source="https://www.nytimes.com/athletic/7045852/2026/02/13/parker-kingston-byu-expelled-rape-charge/">
# Summary of Article: "BYU expels receiver Parker Kingston days after arrest on felony rape charge"

**Source:** The Athletic  
**Date:** February 14, 2026  
**Author:** Christopher Kamrani

## Key Facts and Statistics:

1. **Parker Kingston's Performance:** Led BYU Cougars in receiving yards (924) and receptions (66) during the 2025 season.

2. **Expulsion and Arrest Timeline:**
   - Kingston was arrested on Tuesday, February 11, 2026, in Provo
   - He was expelled from BYU on Friday night, February 14, 2026
   - He is no longer part of the football program

3. **Charge Details:**
   - Kingston, age 21, faces a felony rape charge
   - The alleged incident occurred on February 23, 2025, in St. George, Utah (more than 250 miles south of Provo)
   - The alleged victim was 20 years old at the time

4. **Investigation Timeline:**
   - Alleged victim reported the sexual assault to officers at St. George Regional Hospital on February 27, 2025
   - St. George Police Department conducted a year-long investigation
   - Investigation included gathering digital and forensic evidence and conducting interviews with parties involved and witnesses

5. **Court Proceedings:**
   - First court appearance: Friday afternoon, February 14, 2026 (remote from Purgatory Correctional Facility in Hurricane, Utah)
   - Judge John Walton set bond at $100,000 with $10,000 cash immediately paid
   - Virtual hearing scheduled for February 25, 2026
   - Preliminary in-person hearing scheduled for April 13, 2026, in Fifth District Court in St. George

6. **Kingston's Statement:** According to the affidavit, Kingston told investigators that all sexual activity with the woman was consensual.

7. **University Statement:** BYU stated that university administration, athletic administration, and head coach Kalani Sitake were only made aware of the investigation and allegations after Kingston's arrest on February 11.

8. **Kingston's Status:** Would have been a redshirt senior in 2026.
</Summary>

<Summary source="https://www.si.com/college/byu/football/how-parker-kingston-departure-shakes-up-the-byu-wr-depth-chart">
# Summary of Article: "How Parker Kingston's Departure Shakes Up the BYU WR Depth Chart"

**Source:** BYU Cougars On SI  
**Date:** February 16, 2026

## Key Facts:

1. **Parker Kingston's Status:** Parker Kingston, BYU's leading wide receiver, was removed from the team last week following his arrest. He is no longer part of the 2026 picture.

2. **Impact on Depth Chart:** With Kingston's departure, BYU must replace their top three pass-catchers from the 2025 season.

3. **Spring Camp Timing:** BYU will kick off Spring Camp later this month (February 2026).

## Current Roster Analysis:

**Most Experienced Returning Player:**
- **Jojo Phillips** becomes the most experienced wide receiver on the roster with 25 catches for 377 yards in his career. The article notes he has physical ability but has been limited by injuries and drops.

**Other Returning Players:**
- **Cody Hagen** didn't receive many targets in 2025 but played significant snaps. He was 16 months removed from mission service at the start of the 2025 season and was a highly productive recruit from Utah.

**Statistical Context:**
- BYU wide receivers had only 13 contested catches in 2025, with 9 coming from Chase Roberts (who is presumably no longer on the roster).

**New Additions:**
- **Kyler Kasper** (Oregon transfer) is highlighted as someone who can make contested catches, which is identified as a deficiency in the returning receivers. Aaron Roderick is quoted as "expecting big things" from Kasper.
- Four true freshmen wide receivers are joining: **Jaron Pula**, **Terrance Saryon**, **Legend Glasker**, and one unnamed. Three of them (Pula, Saryon, and Glasker) turned down multiple Power Four offers to attend BYU.
- Pula is specifically mentioned as potentially cracking the rotation soon due to being physically ready for P4 football.

**Other Scholarship Players:**
- **Tiger Bachmeier** (transferred from Stanford before 2025 season, older brother of QB Bear Bachmeier) had 7 catches for 59 yards in 2025 and 409 yards at Stanford in 2023.
- **Reggie Frischknecht** and **Tei Nacua** had limited playing time in 2025.

## Context/Opinions:

The article projects that Phillips and Hagen are the most likely candidates to start, with rotation spots and one additional starting position up for grabs. The author believes Kasper could start immediately if healthy due to his contested catch ability.
</Summary>

**Google I/O 2026 Set for May 19–20, AI Glasses and Gemini Updates Expected**
Google has officially announced that its annual developer conference, Google I/O, will take place from May 19 to 20, 2026, at its headquarters in Mountain View, California, with live streaming available globally. The event will center on artificial intelligence, with major updates to the Gemini large language model series and the unveiling of new AI-integrated hardware and software products. The most anticipated product is Google's first consumer-focused smart glasses, marking its formal entry into the wearable device market. This move is seen as a direct response to Meta's success with its AI glasses, developed in partnership with Ray-Ban, which sold over 7 million units in 2025, a year-on-year increase of over 300%, capturing market leadership. Google confirmed its entry into the space in December 2025, aiming to leverage technological advantages to reshape market dynamics. In 2025, Google I/O already laid the groundwork by announcing a strategic partnership with Warby Parker, a fashion eyewear brand, to co-develop stylish, AI-powered wearable devices—signaling a strategic shift toward integrating fashion and technology to attract a broader consumer base.

**Google Announces Google I/O 2026 and Releases Android 17 Beta 1**
Google has announced the upcoming Google I/O 2026 conference, scheduled for May 19–20, 2026, at the Shoreline Amphitheatre in Mountain View, California, with live online streaming. The event will feature keynote speeches, panel discussions, and product demos covering updates across Google’s entire product lineup. AI remains a central focus, with expected highlights including updates to Gemini, new research demonstrations, and announcements related to the upcoming Android 17 and smart glasses. In coordination with the announcement, Google released the first beta version of Android 17 on February 13, 2026. The platform is set to transition to 'Platform Stability' in March 2026, with the official release targeted for the second quarter of 2026. Android 17 introduces the 'Android Canary' channel, allowing developers to test pre-release APIs and potential behavioral changes earlier in the development cycle, enabling parallel development with Beta. This marks a shift from the traditional phased rollout to a more continuous feedback and improvement model. Android’s release strategy now emphasizes Quarterly Platform Releases (QPR), with multiple updates planned for Android 17, signaling a move from annual major updates to phased, continuous feature rollouts. Regarding Android XR, Google previously announced partnerships with Warby Parker and Gentle Monster at Google I/O 2025, with the first product expected in 2026. With the smart glasses market expanding rapidly—Meta and Ray-Ban’s model has sold over 7 million units annually—expectations are high for Google to reveal more concrete details on product design and development strategy integrating Gemini.

**Tech Mode: The Tech Trends That Will Change Fashion in 2026**
In 2026, technology—particularly artificial intelligence—will continue reshaping the fashion industry, despite challenges in reliability and integration. While AI agents are expected to grow in use for both consumers and businesses, issues like inconsistent outputs, poor system interoperability, and concerns over data privacy and environmental impact persist. Salesforce is reducing reliance on large language models due to their probabilistic nature, favoring more deterministic automation. Despite these hurdles, companies are investing in AI to improve efficiency amid rising costs and volatile markets. The AI bubble remains a concern, with Deutsche Bank identifying it as the top risk to market stability in 2026, potentially affecting luxury spending in the US. Consumer backlash against generative AI is growing due to ethical concerns over training data, job displacement, and environmental costs, with political campaigns in the US increasingly targeting AI. Fashion brands are responding with mixed strategies—some distancing themselves from AI (e.g., Aerie’s pledge not to use AI-generated bodies), while others use AI for marketing (e.g., Equinox’s AI satire campaign). Meanwhile, social media regulation is intensifying, with Australia banning youth access and European countries considering similar laws; US lawsuits allege platforms are designed to be addictive, with major cases set to begin in January 2026. Other emerging trends include smart glasses from Google and Warby Parker, the rise of world models in AI, and AI’s expanding role in fashion jobs like marketing and content creation. The tech industry is also advancing foundational protocols—such as OpenAI’s agentic commerce protocol and the Linux Foundation’s Agentic AI Foundation—to standardize agent communication and collaboration.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 07, 2026 04:00 PM
Source:[The Business of Fashion](https://www.businessoffashion.com/briefings/technology/tech-mode-the-tech-trends-that-will-change-fashion-in-2026/)

**Has the Boxing Day bounce come early for estate agents?**
Strutt & Parker has reported a 173% increase in the number of properties launched to the market between November 26 and December 5, 2025—following the Autumn Budget—compared to the same period in 2024. This surge, described as a 'post-Budget boost' rather than a traditional Boxing Day bounce, is attributed to improved market clarity after a delayed Budget and heightened political uncertainty. Claire Reynolds, UK Head of Sales at Strutt & Parker, noted that the policies announced did not deter vendors, signaling renewed confidence. The total value of homes launched during this 10-day period was nearly three times higher than in the same period in 2024. The average property value launched outside London was £1.2m, while in prime central London it exceeded £4m—both above the 2024 levels. Matt Henderson, residential research lead, emphasized that recent economic and political turbulence has eroded seasonal market patterns, but with interest rates expected to fall and the Budget now behind them, many buyers and sellers are adopting an 'act now' approach. The data suggests positive momentum for the housing market in 2026.
Original language: en

**Google's 2025 Year in Search offers a look inside America's mind**
Google's 2025 Year in Search report reveals insights into the most searched topics in the United States, based on global search data. As of November 2025, Google maintains nearly 90% market share, with Bing holding just over 4%. The report highlights that American search interests were fragmented, with the top three searches being Charlie Kirk, the movie KPop Demon Hunters, and the viral collectible Labubu toys. Other top searches included iPhone 17, the One Big Beautiful Bill Act, Zohran Mamdani, DeepSeek, government shutdown, FIFA Club World Cup, and tariffs. Top news-related searches mirrored these interests, including the One Big Beautiful Bill Act, government shutdown, Charlie Kirk assassination, tariffs, No Kings protest, Los Angeles fires, the selection of a new Pope, the Epstein files, the U.S. Presidential Inauguration, and Hurricane Melissa. The report also includes category-specific trends from Google Maps, such as the most-searched bookstores (Powell's City of Books, Strand Book Store, The Last Bookstore), transit stations (Grand Central Terminal, Penn Station, Port Authority Bus Terminal), state parks (Watkins Glen State Park, Valley of Fire State Park, Liberty State Park), and campgrounds (Ginnie Springs Outdoors, LLC, Ocean Lakes Family Campground, The Campsites at Disney's Fort Wilderness Resort). The full report is available at www.trends.withgoogle.com/year-in-search/2025/.
Original language: en
Publish date: December 04, 2025 08:11 AM
Source:[Android Police](https://www.androidpolice.com/google-2025-year-in-search/)

**Google just revealed the most-searched gifts of 2025. Here's what's worth buying this holiday season | CNN Underscored**
Google has released its annual 'Holiday 100' list of the most-searched gifts of 2025, based on Google Trends data from May to September 2025. The list highlights trending products across categories, including tech, fashion, home, and wellness. Notable gifts include the Nintendo Switch 2, which saw high search interest and is now more readily available, with prices ranging from $449 to $450 across major retailers. For home cooks, the Made In Round Enameled Cast-Iron Dutch Oven ($265–$269) was praised for its performance and value. The Cozy Earth Bubble Cuddle Blanket ($183–$228) and Bombas Merino Wool Blend Calf Socks ($22 and up) were top picks for comfort. Fashion items like the Coach Nolita 19 ($109 at Coach Outlet), Kendra Scott Bella Gold Hoop Earrings ($78–$98), and Warby Parker Elio Sunglasses ($95 and up) were highlighted for style and popularity. Hobby-related gifts such as the Pink Picasso Paint-by-Number Kit (from $46) and The Woobles Easy Peasy Beginner Bundle ($100) saw significant search increases. Tech and wellness items like the Oura Ring 4 ($349), Therabody TheraFace Mask ($650), and XGIMI MoGo 3 Pro Portable Projector ($399) also ranked highly. The list is curated by CNN Underscored editors based on product testing, editor favorites, and real-world popularity, with all selections meeting Google's criteria for 'all-time high' or 'breakout' search interest. The data reflects trends driven by consumer behavior, with some products influenced by brand partnerships but still vetted for quality.

**Predictions 2026: Consumers Find Connection In Unexpected Places**
Forrester's 2026 consumer predictions highlight a growing desire for connection amid global turbulence, including ongoing geopolitical unrest, economic uncertainty from tariffs, and rising concerns about AI's societal impact. Despite a seemingly 'doom and gloom' backdrop—evidenced by a month-long U.S. government shutdown, Middle East instability, a WHO mental health report, and a high-profile museum heist—consumers are turning to connection as a source of resilience. In 2026, this connection will manifest in unexpected ways: 20% of Gen Z and Gen Alpha consumers are predicted to use AI companions, drawn to their always-on, private, and non-judgmental nature, though this trend raises serious concerns about mental health and privacy. Simultaneously, a third of consumers will prioritize offline brand experiences over digital ones, with in-person shopping rising—evidenced by a seven-point increase in intent during the 2025 winter holiday season—and brands like Starbucks and TikTok investing in real-life engagement. Additionally, AI glasses are expected to launch the AI wearables race, with 10% of consumers trialing them in 2026, driven by innovations from Meta, Google (in partnership with Warby Parker and Gentle Monster), Alibaba’s Quark, and Amazon’s planned release in late 2026 or early 2027. These trends reflect a shift toward hybrid connection—balancing digital convenience with human and physical presence. Forrester urges businesses to adapt through its Predictions 2026 guide and client sessions.
Original language: en
Publish date: October 31, 2025 01:59 PM
Source:[Forrester](https://www.forrester.com/blogs/predictions-2026-consumers-find-connection-in-unexpected-places/)

**Retail peak season: Your 2025/26 marketing must-do list is here**
South African shoppers are increasingly relying on research, with search interest for 'reviews' rising 30% across retail categories and 40% specifically in apparel during last year's peak season, according to Ricky Hendricks, Google South Africa's industry manager for retail. He notes that 75% of shoppers use three or more channels for both research and shopping, highlighting the importance of omnichannel strategies. Makro, a grocery and electronics retailer, leveraged Local Inventory Ads—showing real-time stock availability on Google at nearby stores—to achieve a 10% higher online conversion rate and a 15% increase in gross merchandise value. For the 2025–2026 peak season, retailers are advised to adopt a holistic marketing calendar from October to January. In October, build anticipation and loyalty via VIP email and WhatsApp databases with early Black Friday access. In November, cross-promote Christmas and Black Friday with targeted discounts and urgency-driven ads to grow the database and capture early sales. During Black Friday weekend, use Performance Max campaigns to drive high-volume sales and clear stock, while sending post-purchase vouchers valid until 25 December to boost further Christmas sales. In December and January, shift to emotional, full-funnel campaigns centered on family, food, and holiday cheer, while bidding on New Year’s resolution keywords like 'fitness tracker' and 'home storage ideas'. VIP members receive early access to New Year’s bundles from 26 December to 1 January. Finally, throughout January, target three audiences—fitness and health enthusiasts, home improvement fans, and parents shopping for back-to-school—with themed campaigns. This phased approach extends customer lifetime value and positions brands as the go-to provider for the entire season.
Original language: en
Publish date: October 22, 2025 12:00 AM
Source:[Think with Google](https://www.thinkwithgoogle.com/intl/en-emea/marketing-strategies/search/black-friday-retail-peak-season-strategy-2025-2026/)
